unnormalised: Hey, that's interesting! I've heard good things about Ayurveda. My cousin, Priya, went to a retreat in Kerala, near Kochi, for panchakarma after Diwali. She said it really helped her de-stress from work at Infosys. Thinking of trying it myself sometime. Maybe for joint pain? Anyone tried it for that? How much did it cost, roughly? And did you stick to the diet? No biryani during treatment, right? ;)
normalised: Hey, that's interesting! I've heard good things about Ayurveda. My cousin, Priya, went to a retreat in Kerala, near Kochi, for panchakarma after Diwali. She said it really helped her de-stress from work at I N F O S Y S. Thinking of trying it myself sometime. Maybe for joint pain? Anyone tried it for that? How much did it cost, roughly? And did you stick to the diet? No biryani during treatment, right? ;)
